intro: Fagraea berteroana, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces small, round, greenish-yellow fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. Fagraea berteroana prefers warm, humid climates and is adaptable to various soil types.
